messages.name: IMC
messages.description:
This document describes the communications protocol associated with the LSTS software framework. Concepts such as *message*, *field* and *packet* are explained in detail in the subsequent chapters.
Inter module communication is achieved by the exchange of messages that can be recognized and interpreted by all participating modules. A message is a self-contained collection of data fields conveying relevant information about a given subject. The mean by which the messages are exchanged is not described in this document, but the reader can assume that at least the UDP Internet protocol is available at all ends of the communications channel.
The Neptus Command and Control Unit (CCU), currently being used at LSTS, supports mission planning and control, using the described messaging API. This software entity can be used to define a plan before execution and monitor the plan's execution by presenting an operating console. For further details on this software contact the LSTS.
A CCU exercises authority over a vehicle (real or simulated). Usually this term is applied to software in the class of LSTS Neptus, but can also be applied to software modules extending the vehicle core control software.
The LSTS reserves itself the right to use message identification numbers up to 999. Thus if a third party needs to extend this API it must use identification numbers starting at 1000. The identification number 65535 has a special meaning and must not be used to extend the IMC protocol.

types.description: Messages and packets can be viewed as a finite collection of fields. The list of valid field types is presented below.

type.name: fp32_t
type.description: 32 bit single precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: fp64_t
type.description: 64 bit double precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: message
type.description: An inline message. Useful for encapsulating other messages.

serialization.description: To ensure accurate transportation some field types may require special treatment on transmission and reception. The operation of preparing a field type for transmission is called serialization, the inverse action is called deserialization. No special serialization is required for types that are not described in the table below, their values should be used as is.

type.name: rawdata
type.description: A sequence of type *rawdata* is serialized by prepending a value of type *uint16_t*, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of bytes. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct size of data bytes. The *rawdata* type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: plaintext
type.description: A sequence of type *plaintext* is serialized by prepending a value of type *uint16_t*, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of ASCII characters. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct ASCII character sequence size. The *plaintext* type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: message
type.description: A field of type *message* is serialized by prepending a value of type *uint16_t*, representing the identification number of the message, to the serialized message payload. The special identification number 65535 must be used when no message is present. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct message identification number. The *message* type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: message-list
type.description: A field of type *message-list* is serialized by prepending a value of type *uint16_t*, representing the number of messages in the list, to the serialized message payload. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct number of messages

units.description: The following table lists the units used in the subsequent chapters.

unit.name: List of key/value tuples
unit.description: This unit is a list of label/value tuples and is only valid in plaintext fields. The label and value portions of a tuple are separated using the equal sign (=) and tuples are separated using the semicolon character (;). These delimiting characters must not be used elsewhere. Leading and trailing semicolons must be removed. Examples: "label1=12;label2=3" or "label1=12" or "label1=test_2".

header.description: The packet header contains handling information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the beginning of a packet.

field.name: Synchronization Number
field.description:
The synchronization number marks the beginning of a packet.
It denotes the packet API version and can be used to deduce the byte order of the sending host.
It encodes value 0xFE[major][minor] where [major] equals the major version number of the protocol and [minor] equals the minor version of the protocol.
The packet recipient is responsible for the correct interpretation of the synchronization number and byte order conversions.

field.name: Message Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the message contained in the packet. This field is used for correct message interpretation and deserialization.

field.name: Message size
field.description: The size of the message data in the packet.

field.name: Time stamp
field.description: The time when the packet was sent, as seen by the packet dispatcher. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970 using IEEE double precision floating point numbers.

field.name: Source Address
field.description: The Source IMC system ID.

field.name: Source Entity
field.description: The entity generating this message at the source address.

field.name: Destination Address
field.description: The Destination IMC system ID.

field.name: Destination Entity
field.description: The entity that should process this message at the destination address.

footer.description: The packet footer contains validation information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the end of a packet.

field.name: Check Sum (CRC-16-IBM)
field.description: The check sum field is computed using the CRC-16-IBM with polynomial 0x8005 (x^16 + x^15 + x^2 + 1). The data contributing for the CRC includes all preceding header and message bytes.

message.name: Entity State
message.description: State reported by an entity in the vehicle. The source entity is identified in the message header.

field.name: State
field.description: State of entity.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Complementary entity state flags.

field.name: Complementary description
field.description: Complementary human-readable description of entity state.

message.name: Query Entity State
message.description: Request entities to report their state. Entities should respond by issuing an appropriate EntityState message.

message.name: Entity Information
message.description: This message describes an entity.

field.name: Entity Identifier
field.description: Entity identifier.

field.name: Label
field.description: Entity label or empty if the entity id is not valid.

field.name: Component name
field.description: Name of the plugin/component/subsystem associated with this entity.

field.name: Activation Time
field.description: Amount of time needed to properly activate the entity.

field.name: Deactivation Time
field.description: Amount of time needed to properly deactivate the entity.

message.name: Query Entity Information
message.description: Request information about an entity identifier. The receiving system shall reply with an EntityInfo message with the details of that entity.

field.name: Entity Identifier
field.description: Entity identifier.

message.name: Entity List
message.description: This message describes the names and identification numbers of all entities in the system.

field.name: operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

field.name: list
field.description: Example: "Battery=11;CTD=3"

message.name: CPU Usage
message.description: Report of software CPU usage.

field.name: Usage percentage
field.description: The CPU usage, in percentage, of the sending software.

message.name: Transport Bindings
message.description: Message generated when tasks bind to messages.

field.name: Consumer name
field.description: The name of the consumer (e.g. task name).

field.name: Message Identifier
field.description: The id of the message to be listened to.

message.name: Restart System
message.description: Request the destination system to restart itself.

value.name: Dune
value.description: Request a DUNE restart

value.name: System
value.description: Request a system restart.

message.name: Device Calibration Control
message.description: This message controls the calibration procedure of a given device. The destination device is selected using the destination entity identification number.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Start
value.description: Start calibration procedure.

value.name: Stop
value.description: Stop calibration procedure.

value.name: Perform Next Calibration Step
value.description: Perform next step of the calibration procedure.

value.name: Perform Previous Calibration Step
value.description: Perform previous step of the calibration procedure.

message.name: Device Calibration State
message.description: State of the calibration procedure.

field.name: Total Steps
field.description: Total number of steps of the calibration procedure.

field.name: Current Step Number
field.description: Number of the current step being performed.

field.name: Description
field.description: Human-readable description of the current step.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Additional flags.

value.name: Previous Step Not Supported
value.description: Jumping to the previous calibration step is not supported.

value.name: Next Step Not Supported
value.description: Jumping to the next calibration step is not supported.

value.name: Waiting Device Calibration Control
value.description: The calibration procedure was suspended and must be resumed or cancelled with a DeviceCalibrationControl message.

value.name: Calibration Error
value.description: Calibration was interrupted due to an error and must be restarted or cancelled with a DeviceCalibrationControl message.

value.name: Calibration Procedure Completed
value.description: The calibration procedure was completed.

message.name: Entity Activation State
message.description: State of entity activation/deactivation.

field.name: State
field.description: Current state.

value.name: Entity is Inactive
value.description: Entity is inactive.

value.name: Entity is Active
value.description: Entity is active.

value.name: Activation in Progress
value.description: Activation is in progress.

value.name: Activation Completed
value.description: Activation is completed.

value.name: Activation Failed
value.description: The activation procedure failed and the field 'error' contains the error message.

value.name: Deactivation In Progress
value.description: Deactivation is in progress.

value.name: Deactivation Completed
value.description: Deactivation is in progress.

value.name: Deactivation Failed
value.description: The deactivation procedure failed and the field 'error' contains the error message.

field.name: Error
field.description: Human-readable error message.

message.name: Query Entity Activation State
message.description: Query the activation/deactivation state of an entity. The recipient shall reply with an EntityActivationState message.

message.name: Vehicle Operational Limits
message.description: Vehicle opertional limits. For aircraft this should represent the flight envelope and the dynamic contraints.

field.name: Action on the vehicle operational limits
field.description: Action on the vehicle operation limits

field.name: Minimum speed
field.description: Minimum operation speed. For aircraft this is equal or larger then the stall speed.

field.name: Maximum speed
field.description: Maximum operation speed. For aircraft this is limited by the engine power or structural contrains.

field.name: Longitudinal maximum acceleration
field.description: Maximum longitudinal acceleration.

field.name: Maximum MSL altitude
field.description: Maximum altitude above mean-sea-level.

field.name: Maximum Dive Rate Speed Fraction
field.description: Maximum dive rate (negative vertical speed) as a fraction of the longitudinal speed.

field.name: Maximum Climb Rate Speed Fraction
field.description: Maximum climb rate (positive vertical speed) as a fraction of the longitudinal speed.

field.name: Bank limit
field.description: Limit to the bank angle (roll; angle over the xx body-axis).

field.name: Bank rate limit
field.description: Limit to the bank angular rate (roll; angle over the xx body-axis).

field.name: Minimum pitch angle
field.description: Minimum pitch angle (angle over the xx body-axis).

field.name: Maximum pitch angle
field.description: Maximum pitch angle (angle over the xx body-axis).

field.name: Maximum pitch rate
field.description: Maximum pitch angular rate (angle over the xx body-axis).

field.name: Minimum load factor
field.description: Minimum load factor, i.e., maximum positive acceleration in the zz body-axis as a factor of the gravity acceleration at mean-sea-level.

field.name: Maximum load factor
field.description: Maximum load factor, i.e., maximum negative acceleration in the zz body-axis as a factor of the gravity acceleration at mean-sea-level.

field.name: Maximum lateral load factor
field.description: Maximum lateral load factor, i.e., maximum acceleration in the yy body-axis as a factor of the gravity acceleration at mean-sea-level.

field.name: Minimum RPMs
field.description: Minimum motor RPMs.

field.name: Maximum RPMs
field.description: Maximum motor RPMs.

field.name: Maximum RPM rate
field.description: Maximum motor RPMs' rate of change.

message.name: Simulated State
message.description: This message presents the simulated state of the vehicle. The simulated state attempts to provide a realistic state interpretation of operating various kinds of vehicles.

field.name: Latitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Height (WGS-84)
field.description: Height above the WGS-84 ellipsoid.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset down (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw rate).

field.name: Stream Velocity X (North)
field.description: Stream Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Stream Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Stream Velocity zz axis velocity component.

message.name: Leak Simulation
message.description: Simulate leak behavior.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Indicates whether leaks have been detected or not.

field.name: Leak Entities
field.description: Comma separated list of leak entities (empty for all leaks configured).

message.name: Underwater Acoustics Simulation
message.description: Underwater acoustics simulation request.

field.name: Type
field.description: Type of request.

field.name: Transmission Speed
field.description: Transmission speed.

field.name: Data
field.description: Data for transmission requests.

message.name: Dynamics Simulation Parameters
message.description: Vehicle dynamics parameters for 3DOF, 4DOF or 5DOF simulations.

field.name: Action on the Vehicle Simulation Parameters
field.description: Action on the vehicle simulation parameters for the formation control

field.name: TAS to Longitudinal Acceleration Gain
field.description: Proportional gain from the TAS (True Airspeed) error to the longitudinal acceleration.

field.name: Bank to Bank Rate Gain
field.description: Proportional gain from the bank angle error to the bank angular rate.

message.name: Storage Usage
message.description: Report of storage usage.

field.name: Available
field.description: The available storage of the reporting device.

field.name: Usage
field.description: The percentage of storage used by the reporting device.

message.name: Cache Control
message.description: Control caching of messages to persistent storage.

field.name: Control Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

field.name: Snapshot destination
field.description: Destination for the cache snapshot file.

field.name: Message
field.description: Message to store.

message.name: Logging Control
message.description: Control logging of messages to persistent storage.

field.name: Control Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Request Start of Logging
value.description: Request the logging manager to start logging. The logging manager will reply with a STARTED operation. If logging is already in progress the current log will be closed and a new one will be opened (therefore the logging manager will send two messages - STOPPED and STARTED). The field 'name' represents the label that will be appended to the log path.

value.name: Logging Started
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation everytime a log is successfully started. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

value.name: Request Logging Stop
value.description: Request the logging manager to stop logging messages. The logging manager will reply with a STOPPED operation and logging will be suspended until a message with operation START is received. If logging is already stoppped the logging manager will ignore this operation and will not reply with a STOPPED operation. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

value.name: Logging Stopped
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when logging is successfully stopped. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log that was closed.

value.name: Request Current Log Name
value.description: This operation instructs the logging manager to send a message with operation CURRENT_NAME containing the complete name of the current log in the field 'name'. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

value.name: Current Log Name
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when asked via the REQUEST_CURRENT_NAME operation. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

field.name: Log Label / Path
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

message.name: Log Book Entry
message.description: Human readable message reporting an event of interest.

field.name: Type
field.description: Type of message.

field.name: Timestamp
field.description: Timestamp (Epoch time).

field.name: Context
field.description: Message context.

field.name: Text
field.description: Message text.

message.name: Log Book Control
message.description: Control history log.

field.name: Command
field.description: Command to perform.

value.name: Get
value.description: Retrieve log book entries.

value.name: Clear
value.description: Clear log book entries.

value.name: Get Errors
value.description: Retrieve log book entries corresponding to errors.

value.name: Reply
value.description: Reply to a GET command. Message argument is a MessageList instance containing LogBookEntry messages.

field.name: Timestamp
field.description: Timestamp for command (Epoch time).

field.name: Messages
field.description: Argument, currently used only for 'REPLY'.

message.name: Replay Control
message.description: Control replay of LSF logged data.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

field.name: File To Replay
field.description: Pathname of file to replay.

message.name: Clock Control
message.description: Clock control.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Execute Sync.
value.description: Synchronize clock according to given clock value.

value.name: Request Sync.
value.description: Request autonomous clock synchronization.

value.name: Sync. Started
value.description: Synchronization start notification.

value.name: Sync. done
value.description: Synchronization completion notification.

value.name: Set Timezone
value.description: Set timezone.

value.name: Timezone Setup
value.description: Notification due to timezone modification.

field.name: Clock
field.description: Clock value (Epoch time).

field.name: Timezone
field.description: Timezone.

message.name: Historic CTD
message.description: This message is used to store historic (transmitted afterwards) CTD data .

message.name: Historic Telemetry
message.description: This message is used to store historic (transmitted afterwards) telemetry information.

field.name: Roll
field.description: Roll encoded as α.(65535/(2.π))

field.name: Pitch
field.description: Pitch encoded as α.(65535/(2.π))

field.name: Yaw
field.description: Yaw encoded as α.(65535/(2.π))

message.name: Historic Sonar Data
message.description: This message is used to store historic (transmitted afterwards) sonar data.

field.name: Pixels Per Line
field.description: The number of pixels per line as the data in 'sonar_data' may correspond to more than one sequential sidescan lines.

field.name: SonarData
field.description: Sonar data encoded as in 'encoding'.

message.name: Historic Event
message.description: This message is used to store historic event log entries.

field.name: Event Type
field.description: Type of event.

message.name: Vertical Profile
message.description: This message is used to store historic profiles for water parameters: Temperature, Salinity, Chlorophyll...

field.name: Parameter
field.description: Water parameter used to calculate the vertical profile.

field.name: Latitude
field.description: Latitude where the profile was calculated.

field.name: Longitude
field.description: Longitude where the profile was calculated.

message.name: Profile Sample
message.description: Samples to calculate a vertical profile.

message.name: Heartbeat
message.description: The Heartbeat message is used to inform other modules that the sending entity's system is running normally and communications are alive.

message.name: Announce
message.description: A system description that is to be broadcasted to other systems.

field.name: System Name
field.description: System name.

field.name: System Type
field.description: System type.

field.name: Control Owner
field.description: The owner IMC system ID.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude. If lat=0 and lon=0 means location value is unknown.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude. If lat=0 and lon=0 means location value is unknown.

field.name: Height WGS-84
field.description: Height above WGS-84 ellipsoid.

field.name: Services
field.description:
Semicolon separated list of URLs. Examples of such URLs are:
- *imc+udp://192.168.106.34:6002/* - *dune://0.0.0.0/uid/1294925553839635/* - *http://192.168.106.34/dune/*.

message.name: Announce Service
message.description: Announcement about the existence of a service.

field.name: Service
field.description: Semicolon separated list of URLs (see :ref:`Announce`).

field.name: ServiceType
field.description: Informs about the availability of the service on internal and external networks.

message.name: Receive Signal Strength Information
message.description: Measure of the RSSI by a networking device. Indicates the gain or loss in the signal strength due to the transmission and reception equipment and the transmission medium and distance.

field.name: Value
field.description: RSSI measurement.

message.name: Voltage Standing Wave Ratio
message.description: Measure of the VSWR by a networking device.

field.name: Value
field.description: VSWR measurement.

message.name: Link Level
message.description: Measurement of link level quality. For instance, this may correspond to the acknowledgment ratio of a link. But, generally, the measure is link-dependent.

field.name: Value
field.description: Link level value.

message.name: SMS
message.description: Send a SMS message.

field.name: Number
field.description: Target mobile device number.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Timeout for sending message.

field.name: Contents
field.description: Message contents.

message.name: SMS Transmit
message.description: Request to send SMS.

field.name: Sequence Number
field.description: Sequence number.

field.name: Destination
field.description: Number or name of the recipient.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Timeout for sending message.

field.name: Data
field.description: Message data.

message.name: SMS Receive
message.description: Received SMS data.

field.name: Source
field.description: Number of name of the sender.

field.name: Data
field.description: Message data.

field.name: Sequence Number
field.description: Sequence number.

field.name: State
field.description: Current state of an SMS transaction.

message.name: Text Message
message.description: A text message has been received.

field.name: Origin
field.description: Message origin (if known).

field.name: Text
field.description: Message contents.

field.name: Origin Identifier
field.description: The unique identifier of this message's origin device (e.g. lauv-xtreme-2, manta-0).

field.name: Timestamp
field.description: Timestamp (Epoch time).

field.name: Data
field.description: Message data.

field.name: Request Identifier
field.description: The request identifier used to receive transmission updates.

field.name: Time to live
field.description: Time, in seconds, after which there will be no more atempts to transmit the message.

field.name: Destination Identifier
field.description: The unique identifier of this message's destination (e.g. lauv-xtreme-2, manta-0).

field.name: Data
field.description: Message data.

field.name: Request Identifier
field.description: The request identifier used to receive transmission updates

value.name: Error while trying to transmit message
Message has been queued for transmission
Message's TTL has expired. Transmition cancelled.
No more messages to be transmitted or received.

message.name: Group Membership State
message.description: Group communication link assertion.

field.name: Group Name
field.description: Name of the group of systems.

field.name: Communication Links Assertion
field.description: Communication link assertion for each group member. One bit to assert each system communication link state.

message.name: System Group
message.description: Group of systems configuration.

field.name: Group Name
field.description: Name of the group of systems.

field.name: Group List Action
field.description: Actions on the group list.

field.name: Systems Name List
field.description: List of names of system in the group, separated by commas.

message.name: Link Latency
message.description: Communications latency between two systems.

field.name: Value
field.description: Time taken between the communications package/message is sent from the source until it arrives to the destination.

field.name: Communications Source System ID
field.description: ID of system that was the source of the communication package.

message.name: Extended Receive Signal Strength Information
message.description: Measure of the RSSI by a networking device. Indicates the gain or loss in the signal strenght due to the transmission and reception equipment and the transmission medium and distance.

field.name: Value
field.description: RSSI measurement.

field.name: RSSI Units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the RSSI value.

message.name: Historic Data Series
message.description: This message holds a list of inline data samples produced by one or more vehicles in the past. It is used to transfer data over disruption tolerant networks.

field.name: Base Latitude
field.description: All data sent inside this message will have offsets relative to this latitude.

field.name: Base Longitude
field.description: All data sent inside this message will have offsets relative to this longitude.

field.name: Base Timestamp
field.description: All data sent inside this message will use this time as the origin (0).

message.name: Compressed Historic Data Series
message.description: This message holds a list of inline data samples produced by one or more vehicles in the past. It is used to transfer data over disruption tolerant networks.

field.name: Base Latitude
field.description: All data sent inside this message will have offsets relative to this latitude.

field.name: Base Longitude
field.description: All data sent inside this message will have offsets relative to this longitude.

field.name: Base Timestamp
field.description: All data sent inside this message will use this time as the origin (0).

field.name: Data
field.description: A message-list of HistoricSample messages compressed with GZip algorithm.

field.name: Original System Id
field.description: The IMC identifier of the system that produced this sample.

field.name: Priority
field.description: The priority for this data sample. Default priority is 0. Samples with higher priorities will *always* be transmitted before samples with lower priorities. Samples with -127 priority will not be transmitted but just logged to disk locally.

field.name: X offset
field.description: Northing offsets relative to base latitude / longitude expressed in the enclosing `HistoricData` message.

field.name: Y offset
field.description: Easting offsets relative to base latitude / longitude expressed in the enclosing `HistoricData` message.

field.name: Z offset
field.description: Altitude / depth offsets relative to sea level expressed in decimeters. Negative values mean depth and positive values mean altitude.

field.name: Time offset
field.description: Time offset in seconds relative to the base time expressed in the enclosing `HistoricData` message.

value.name: Query
value.description: Request data from the Data Store

value.name: Reply
value.description: Data Store response with Data (using field 'data')

value.name: Clear
value.description: Clear 'data' from the Data Store

message.name: Remote Command
message.description: Command to remote system. If a system receives a RemoteCommand and it isn't the intended recipient, then it should resend it.

field.name: Original Source
field.description: IMC id of the original sender.

field.name: Destination
field.description: IMC id of the recipient.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Expiration time of the message (Epoch Time), in seconds. If the message doesn't reach the destination within timeout, the validity of the message expires and there will be no more attempts to transmit the message.

field.name: Command
field.description: Command to be unpacked by the recipient.

message.name: Communication Systems Query
message.description: Presence of Communication Interfaces query.

value.name: Query Systems
value.description: Query systems about communication capability

value.name: Reply
value.description: Reply systems about communication capability

field.name: Communication Interface
field.description: Communication interface to be used for reports.

value.description: Use acoustic communications

value.name: Satellite

value.name: GSM
value.description: Use Global System for Mobile Communications

value.name: Mobile
value.description: Use mobile networks

value.name: Radio
value.description: Use Radio telemetry

value.name: unknown
value.description: Model is not defined

value.name: 3DR

message.description: This message is used to report the perceived link quality to other acoustic peers.

field.name: Received Signal Strength Indicator
field.description: RSSI is a signed floating point number. Higher RSSI values correspond to stronger signals. The signal strength is acceptable when measured RSSI values lie between -20 dB and -85 dB.

field.name: Signal Integrity Level
field.description: Signal Integrity value illustrates distortion of the last received acoustic signal. It is calculated based on cross-correlation measurements. Higher *Signal Integrity Level* values correspond to less distorted signals. An acoustic link is considered weak if the *Signal Integrity Level* value is less than 100.

message.name: Sonar Data
message.description:
This message contains the data acquired by a single sonar measurement. The following describes the format used to fill the data field used in this message. (Byte order is little endian.)
**Sidescan:**
+------+-------------------+-----------+ | Data | Name | Type | +======+===================+===========+ | A | Ranges data | uintX_t | +------+-------------------+-----------+
.. figure:: ../images/imc_sidescan.png
* The type *uintX_t* will depend on the number of bits per unit, and it should be a multiple of 8. * Furthermore, for now, 32 bits is the highest value of bits per unit supported.
**Multibeam:**
+------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Index| Section| Name | Type | Comments | +======+========+=========================+=========+======================================================================+ | 1 | H1 | Number of points | uint16_t| Number of data points | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 2 | H2 | Start angle | fp32_t | In radians | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 3 | H3 | Flags | uint8_t | Refer to next table | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 4 | H4 ? | Angle scale factor | fp32_t | Used for angle steps in radians | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 5 | H5 ? | Intensities scale factor| fp32_t | | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 6 | D1 ? | Angle steps[H1] | uint16_t| Values in radians | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 7 | D2 | Ranges[H1] | uintX_t | Ranges data points (scale factor from common field "Scaling Factor") | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 8 | D3 ? | Intensities[H1] | uintX_t | Intensities data points | +------+--------+-------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
+--------+------------------+-----+ | Section| Flag Label | Bit | +========+==================+=====+ | H4.1 | Intensities flag | 0 | +--------+------------------+-----+ | H4.2 | Angle step flag | 1 | +--------+------------------+-----+
.. figure:: ../images/imc_multibeam.png
*Notes:*
* Each angle at step *i* can be calculated is defined by:
.. code-block:: python
angle[i] = H2_start_angle + (32-bit sum of D1_angle_step[0] through D1_angle_step[i]) * H4_scaling_factor
* If bit H4.1 is not set then sections H5 and D3 won't exist. * If bit H4.2 is not set then sections H4 and D1 won't exist. In case this bit is set, then the angle steps is read from field "Beam Width" from "Beam Configuration". * The type *uintX_t* will depend on the number of bits per unit, and it should be a multiple of 8. * Furthermore, for now, 32 bits is the highest value of bits per unit supported.
*How to write ranges and intensities data:*
.. code-block:: python :linenos:
data_unit = (Integer) (data_value / scale_factor); bytes_per_unit = bits_per_unit / 8; LOOP: i = 0, until i = bytes_per_unit byte[i] = (data_unit >> 8 * i) & 0xFF);
write(byte);
**Common:**

message.name: External Navigation Data
message.description:
This message is a representation of the state of the vehicle, as seen by an external navigation computer.
An example usage is when DUNE is used with ardupilot. The data gathered from the autopilot is a complete navigation solution.
ExternalNavData contains an inline Estimated State, which is a complete description of the system in terms of parameters such as position, orientation and velocities at a particular moment in time.
The Type field selects wether the navigation data is a full state estimation, or only concerns attitude or position/velocity.

field.name: Estimated State
field.description: External Navigation Data.

field.description: The type of external navigation data

message.name: Remote Actions Request
message.description: This message is used as query to request for the possible remote actions (operation=QUERY and the list is empty in this case). The vehicle responds using the same message type returning the tuplelist with the pairs: Action,Type (operation=REPORT). The type of action can be Axis, Hat or Button.

message.name: Power Operation
message.description: This message allows controlling the system's power lines.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation type.

value.name: Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices immediately. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Down in Progress
value.description: The latest power down request is in progress and the time remaining until power down is given in field 'time_remain'.

value.name: Power Down Aborted
value.description: The latest power down request was aborted.

value.name: Schedule Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices.

value.name: Power Up in Progress
value.description: The latest power up request is in progress.

value.name: Schedule Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power up.

field.name: Time Remaining
field.description: Time remaining to complete operation.

field.name: Scheduled Time
field.description: Scheduled time of operation.

message.name: Estimated State
message.description:
This message presents the estimated state of the vehicle.
EstimatedState is a complete description of the system in terms of parameters such as position, orientation and velocities at a particular moment in time.
The system position is given by a North-East-Down (NED) local tangent plane displacement (x, y, z) relative to an absolute WGS-84 coordinate (latitude, longitude, height above ellipsoid).
The symbols for position and attitude as well as linear and angular velocities were chosen according to SNAME's notation (1950). The body-fixed reference frame and Euler angles are depicted next:
.. figure:: ../images/euler-lauv.png :align: center
Euler angles

field.name: Latitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Height (WGS-84)
field.description: Height above the WGS-84 ellipsoid.

message.name: LBL Range Acceptance
message.description: When the vehicle uses Long Base Line navigation, this message notifies that a new range was received from one of the acoustics transponders. The message fields are used to identify the range value and the transponder name. Also, this message has an acceptance field that indicates whether a LBL range was accepted or rejected, and if rejected, the reason why.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

field.name: Range
field.description: Distance to the acoustic transponder.

field.name: Acceptance
field.description: Reason for acceptance/rejection.

value.name: Accepted
value.description: This LBL range is accepted by the navigation filter.

value.name: Rejected - Above Threshold
value.description: New LBL Range is above a computed threshold.

value.name: Rejected - Singular Point
value.description: Singular point.

value.name: Rejected - Not Enough Information
value.description: The filter lacks information to properly use the received LBL range.

value.name: Rejected - Vehicle At Surface
value.description: Vehicle is using only GPS fix when it is at surface.

message.name: DVL Rejection
message.description: When the vehicle uses Doppler Velocity Log sensor, this message notifies that a new measurement was locally rejected by the navigation filter.

field.name: Type of velocity
field.description: This field represents the type of the rejected velocity.

field.name: Reason
field.description: Reason for rejection. There are two types of DVL measurement filters. An Innovation filter checks the innovation between the current measurement and the previous measurement within a certain amount of time and an Absolute filter compares the measurement with an absolute threshold value. Those filters are tested using horizontal speed measurements, i.e., measurements in the x-axis and in the y-axis.

value.name: Innovation Threshold - X
value.description: The current DVL x-axis measurement is discarded because the absolute difference between the value and the previous accepted DVL measurement with a given time window is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Innovation Threshold - Y
value.description: The current DVL y-axis measurement is discarded because the absolute difference between the value and the previous accepted DVL measurement with a given time window is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Absolute Threshold - X
value.description: The current DVL x-axis measurement is discarded because the the absolute value is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Absolute Threshold - Y
value.description: The current DVL y-axis measurement is discarded because the the absolute value is above a configurable threshold.

field.name: Value
field.description: Value of the rejection. If it is an innovation rejection the value is the absolute difference between the previous accepted DVL measurement and the current one. If it is an absolute rejection the value is the current DVL measurement.

field.name: Timestep
field.description: Timestep of the rejection. The timestep is 0 for an absolute rejection since it is an instantaneous reading. For innovation rejection it is the time difference between the previous accepted DVL measurement and the current one.

message.name: Desired Path
message.description:
Perform path control.
The path is specified by two WGS-84 waypoints, respective altitude / depth settings, optional loitering at the end point, and some control flags.
The start and end waypoints are defined by the specified end point fields ('end_{lat/lon/z}') plus:
1. the start waypoint fields ('start_{lat|lon|z}') if the 'START' flag (bit in 'flags' field) is set; or 2. the end point of the previous path recently tracked; or 3. the current location is the 'DIRECT' flag is set or if the tracker has been idle for some time.
Altitude and depth control can be performed as follows:
1. by default, the tracker will just transmit an altitude/depth reference value equal to 'end_z' to the appropriate controller; 2. if the 'NO_Z' flag is set no altitude/depth control will take place, hence they can be controlled independently; 3. if the '3DTRACK' flag is set, 3D-tracking will be done (if supported by the active controller).
Loitering can be specified at the end point with a certain radius ('lradius'), duration ('lduration'), and clockwise or counter-clockwise direction ('CCLOCKW' flag).

field.name: Path Reference
field.description: Unsigned integer reference for the scope of the desired path message. Path reference should only be set by a maneuver. Should be set to an always increasing reference at the time of dispatching this message. Lower level path controllers must inherit the same path reference sent by maneuver.

field.name: Start Point -- Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the start point's z reference.

field.name: End Point -- WGS84 Latitude
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the end point's z reference.

field.name: Speed
field.description: Maneuver speed reference.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Speed units.

field.name: Loiter -- Radius
field.description: Radius for loitering at end point. Specify less or equal to 0 for no loitering.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Desired Path flags.

value.name: Start Point
value.description: Indicates that the start point specification is given, therefore it should be considered for tracking.

value.name: Direct
value.description: If start point is not given, ignore also the previous path's endpoint and take the start point to be the current vehicle location.

value.name: No Altitude/Depth control
value.description: Ignore altitude/depth setting and let them be controlled independently.

value.name: 3D Tracking
value.description: Perform 3D-tracking, i.e., consider the path formed in the XYZ plane taking into account both the 'start_z' and 'end_z' values.

value.name: Counter-Clockwise loiter
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done counter-clockwise. Clockwise loitering will apply otherwise.

value.name: Loiter from current position
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done from the current vehicle position. The end_lat and end_lon fields will be ignored.

value.name: Takeoff
value.description: Indicates that takeoff should be done before going to the end position.

value.name: Land
value.description: Indicates that the system should land at the end position.

message.name: Goto Maneuver
message.description:
A "Goto" is a maneuver specifying a movement of the vehicle to a target waypoint. The waypoint is described by the WGS-84 waypoint coordinate and target Z reference.
Mandatory parameters defined for a "Goto" are timeout, speed and speed units.
Optional parameters may be defined for the target Euler Angles (roll, pitch and yaw) though these parameters may not be considered by all maneuver controllers in charge of the execution of this type of maneuver.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Target reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Z Units
field.description: Units of the z reference.

field.name: Speed
field.description: Maneuver speed reference.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Speed units.

field.name: Roll
field.description: The phi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be unconsidered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be disconcerted. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be considered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Formation Parameters
message.description:
A "Formation" is defined by the relative positions of the vehicles inside the formation, and the reference frame where this positions are defined.
The formation reference frame may be: - Earth Fixed: Where the vehicles relative position do not depend on the followed path. This results in all UAVs following the same path with an offset relative to each other; - Path Fixed: Where the vehicles relative position depends on the followed path, changing the inter-vehicle offset direction with the path direction. - Path Curved: Where the vehicles relative position depends on the followed path, changing the inter-vehicle offset direction with the path direction and direction change rate. An offset in the xx axis results in a distance over the curved path line. An offset in the yy axis results in an offset of the vehicle path line relative to the formation center path line.

field.name: Formation Name
field.description: Name of the formation configuration.

field.name: Formation Reference Frame
field.description: Formation reference frame

field.name: Formation Participants
field.description: List of formation participants.

field.name: Custom settings for formation
field.description: Custom settings for the formation configuration.

message.name: Formation Plan Execution
message.description: A "Formation Plan" is a maneuver specifying a plan for a team of vehicles. The maneuver defines: - Vehicles included in the formation group - Formation shape configuration - Plan (set of maneuvers) to be followed by the formation center - Speed at which that plan is followed - Path contrains (virtual leader bank limit) - Supervision settings

field.name: Target Group Name
field.description: Target group for the formation plan.

field.name: Formation Name
field.description: Name of the formation configuration.

field.name: Formation Plan ID
field.description: The flight plan's identifier. Flight plan defined to be tracked by the formation leader.

field.name: Plan Description
field.description: Verbose text description of plan.

field.name: Formation Leader Flight Airspeed
field.description: Formation leader flight airspeed during the plan tracking.

field.name: Formation leader flight bank limit
field.description: Formation leader flight bank limit during the plan tracking.

field.name: Position mismatch limit
field.description: Limit for the position mismatch between real and simulated position, before a maneuver abort is asserted.

field.name: Position mismatch threshold
field.description: Warning threshold for the position mismatch between real and simulated position. Above this threshold a time-out limit is evaluated to assert a maneuver abort state.

field.name: Position mismatch time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run after the position mismatch threshold is surpassed.

field.name: Convergence threshold
field.description: Threshold for the convergence measure, above which a time-out limit is evaluated to assert a maneuver abort state.

field.name: Convergence time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run after the convergence threshold is surpassed.

field.name: Communications time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run without any update on the other formation vehicles states.

field.name: Turbulence limit
field.description: Turbulence limit above which a maneuver abort is asserted.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Follow Reference Maneuver
message.description: This maneuver follows a reference given by an external entity.

field.name: Controlling Source
field.description: The IMC identifier of the source system that is allowed to provide references to this maneuver. If the value ''0xFFFF'' is used, any system is allowed to command references.

field.name: Controlling Entity
field.description: The entity identifier of the entity that is allowed to provide references to this maneuver. If the value ''0xFF'' is used, any entity is allowed to command references.

field.name: Reference Update Timeout
field.description: The ammount of time, in seconds, after which the maneuver will be terminated if no reference has been received. In other words, the controlling entity should send reference updates in shorter periods than 'timeout'.

field.name: Loiter Radius
field.description: Whenever an intended reference is achieved, this maneuver will maintain the vehicle in vaticiny of that location. The loiter radius is used to define the radius of this (xy) area.

field.name: Altitude Interval
field.description: Similarly to Loiter Radius, this field is used to define the "z" distance considered to be inside the vacitiny of the target location. An AUV may, for instance, be floating until it more than z units above the current reference, in which case it actively changes its position in order to achieve the desired depth / altitude.

field.name: Controlling Entity

message.name: Dislodge Maneuver
message.description:
A "Dislodge" is a maneuver ordering the vehicle to attempt a series of thruster operations that will hopefully get it unstuck from an entangled condition.
Parameters are RPMs for the motor when attempting dislodge and and a flag specifying whether the thrust burst should be attempted forward, backward or auto (letting the vehicle decide).

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: RPM
field.description: Maneuver RPM reference.

field.name: Direction
field.description: Direction to which the vehicle should attempt to unstuck.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Formation
message.description:
The "Formation" is a controller to execute a maneuver with a team of vehicles. It defines the: - Vehicles included in the formation group - Vehicles relative positions inside the formation - Reference frame where the relative positions are defined - Formation shape configuration - Plan (set of maneuvers) to be followed by the formation center - Plan contrains (virtual leader speed and bank limits) - Supervision settings
The formation reference frame may be: - Earth Fixed: Where the vehicles relative position do not depend on the followed path. This results in all UAVs following the same path with an offset relative to each other; - Path Fixed: Where the vehicles relative position depends on the followed path, changing the inter-vehicle offset direction with the path direction. - Path Curved: Where the vehicles relative position depends on the followed path, changing the inter-vehicle offset direction with the path direction and direction change rate. An offset in the xx axis results in a distance over the curved path line. An offset in the yy axis results in an offset of the vehicle path line relative to the formation center path line.

field.name: Formation Name
field.description: Name of the formation configuration.

field.name: Type
field.description: Indicates if the message is a request, or a reply to a previous request.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Start
value.description: Start the formation maneuver.

value.name: Stop
value.description: Stop the formation maneuver.

value.name: Ready
value.description: Stop the formation maneuver.

value.name: Executing
value.description: Stop the formation maneuver.

value.name: Failure
value.description: Stop the formation maneuver.

field.name: Target Group Name
field.description: Target group for the formation plan.

field.name: Formation Plan ID
field.description: The flight plan's identifier. Flight plan defined to be tracked by the formation leader.

field.name: Plan Description
field.description: Verbose text description of plan.

field.name: Formation Reference Frame
field.description: Formation reference frame

field.name: Formation Participants
field.description: List of formation participants.

field.name: Formation Leader Bank Limit
field.description: Maximum absolute bank allowed for the formation leader.

field.name: Formation Leader Minimum Speed
field.description: Minimum speed allowed for the formation leader flight.

field.name: Formation Leader Maximum Speed
field.description: Maximum speed allowed for the formation leader flight.

field.name: Formation Leader Minimum Altitude
field.description: Minimum altitude allowed for the formation leader flight.

field.name: Formation Leader Maximum Altitude
field.description: Maximum altitude allowed for the formation leader flight.

field.name: Position mismatch limit
field.description: Limit for the position mismatch between real and simulated position, before a maneuver abort is asserted.

field.name: Position mismatch threshold
field.description: Warning threshold for the position mismatch between real and simulated position. Above this threshold a time-out limit is evaluated to assert a maneuver abort state.

field.name: Position mismatch time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run after the position mismatch threshold is surpassed.

field.name: Convergence threshold
field.description: Threshold for the convergence measure, above which a time-out limit is evaluated to assert a maneuver abort state.

field.name: Convergence time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run after the convergence threshold is surpassed.

field.name: Communications time-out
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run without any update on the other formation vehicles states.

field.name: Turbulence limit
field.description: Turbulence limit above which a maneuver abort is asserted.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Launch Maneuver
message.description:
A "Launch" is a maneuver specifying a movement of the vehicle to a target waypoint after being launched from a ship or pier. The waypoint is described by the WGS-84 waypoint coordinate and target Z reference.
Mandatory parameters defined for a "Launch" are timeout, speed and speed units.

message.name: Scheduled Goto
message.description:
This maneuver is used to command the vehicle to arrive at some destination at a specified absolute time.
The vehicle's speed will vary according to environment conditions and/or maneuver start time.

field.name: Time of arrival
field.description: Unix timestamp, in seconds, for the arrival at the destination.

field.name: Destination Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Destination Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Destination Z Reference
field.description: Target reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Z Units
field.description: Units of the destination z reference.

field.name: Travel Z Reference
field.description: Z reference to use while travelling to the destination.

field.name: Travel Z Units
field.description: Z reference units to use while travelling to the destination.

field.name: Delayed Behavior
field.description: What to do if the vehicle fails to arrive before or at the requested time.

value.name: Resume
value.description: If the vehicle fails to arrive at the specified time, it will keep going to the destination at top speed and only then consider this maneuver completed.

value.name: Skip
value.description: If the vehicle fails to arrive at the specified time, it will stop the current maneuver and advance to the next one (independently of how far it is from destination).

value.name: Fail
value.description: If the vehicle fails to arrive at the specified time, it will stop the execution of this maneuver with a FAILED result (the entire plan will be stopped).

message.name: Takeoff Maneuver
message.description:
Automatic takeoff for UAVs. This maneuver specifies a target waypoint where to takeoff.
Takeoff direction is set from the direction the plane is pointing when the auto takeoff command is started. It will remain that way until the vehicle reaches the target z reference. After that it will go to the target waypoint.

message.description: This maneuver follows a direct command given by an external entity.

field.name: Controlling Source
field.description: The IMC identifier of the source system that is allowed to provide command to this maneuver. If the value ''0xFFFF'' is used, any system is allowed to command references.

field.name: Controlling Entity
field.description: The entity identifier of the entity that is allowed to provide commands to this maneuver. If the value ''0xFF'' is used, any entity is allowed to command references.

field.name: Reference Update Timeout
field.description: The ammount of time, in seconds, after which the maneuver will be terminated if no new command has been received. In other words, the controlling entity should send command updates in shorter periods than 'timeout'.

message.description: This message must be sent by an external entity to provide command references to a system running a "Follow Command Maneuver". If no Command messages are transmitted, the system will terminate maneuver.

field.description: Current mode autonomy level.

value.name: Manual
value.description: Autopilot has no control

value.name: Assisted
value.description: Autopilot has some control

value.name: Auto
value.description: Autopilot has full control

field.name: Mode
field.description: Current mode name.

message.name: Formation Tracking State
message.description: Monitoring variables to assert the formation tracking state, i.e., the mismatch between the real and the simulated aircraft position, the convergence state, etc.

field.name: Type
field.description: Indicates if the message is a request, or a reply to a previous request.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Start
value.description: Start the formation maneuver.

value.name: Stop
value.description: Stop the formation maneuver.

field.name: Position Mismatch
field.description: Mismatch between the real and the simulated aircraft position.

field.name: Convergence
field.description: Convergence evalution variable. Value indicates the position error to which the system is converging, tacking into account the aircraft current position error and velocity.

field.name: Stream Turbulence
field.description: Evaluation of the stream turbulence level, through the stream acceleration.

field.name: Position Mismatch Monitor
field.description: Position mismatch monitoring flag.

field.name: Communications Monitor
field.description: Communications monitoring flag.

field.name: Convergence
field.description: Convergence monitoring flag.

message.name: Report Control
message.description: This message is sent to trigger reports to a destination system.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Request Start of Reports
value.description: Request a system to periodically send reports through 'interface'. The destination system will reply with a STARTED command. Periodicity will be defined by the field 'period'. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Report Started
value.description: The destination system will reply a message with this operation everytime a report is successfully started. The periodicity of reports is indicated in the field 'period' while the communication interface to be used is described in field 'interface'. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Request Stop of Reports
value.description: Request a system to stop dispatching reports through a given communication interface described in 'interface'. The destination system will reply with a STOPPED command. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Report Stopped
value.description: The destination system will reply a message with this operation everytime a scheduled report is successfully stopped in a defined communication interface. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Request Single Reports
value.description: Request a system to issue a single report in a defined communication interface. The destination system will reply with a REPORT_ISSUED command. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Single Report Sent
value.description: The destination system will reply a single report request with this operation.If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

field.name: Communication Interface
field.description: Communication interface to be used for reports.

value.name: Acoustic
value.description: Use acoustic communications

value.name: Satellite
value.description: Use satellite communications

value.name: GSM
value.description: Use Global System for Mobile Communications

value.name: Mobile
value.description: Use mobile networks

value.name: Radio
value.description: Use Radio telemetry

field.name: Period
field.description: Desired periodicity for scheduled reports.

field.name: Destination System
field.description: Destination Address to be filled where applicable. It should be interpreted differently depending on communication interface.

message.name: State Report
message.description: Concise representation of entire system state.

field.name: Time Stamp
field.description: Time, in seconds, since January 1st 1970.

field.name: Latitude
field.description: Latitude of the system, in degrees.

field.name: Longitude
field.description: Longitude of the system, in degrees.

field.name: Altitude
field.description: Altitude of the system, in decimeters. * *0xFFFF* used for unknown / not applicable value.

field.name: Depth
field.description: Depth of the system, in decimeters. * *0xFFFF* used for unknown / not applicable value.

field.name: Heading
field.description: Calculated as `(rads * (0xFFFF / (2 * PI))`

field.name: Speed
field.description: Speed of the system in centimeters per second.

field.name: Fuel
field.description: System fuel gauge. * *-1* means unknown fuel level.

field.name: Execution State
field.description: Progress of execution or idle state. * *-1* means Service mode * *-2* means Boot mode * *-3* means Calibration mode * *-4* means Error mode

field.name: Plan Checksum
field.description: Checksum of the plan being executed.

message.name: Transmission Request
message.description: Request data to be sent over a specified communication mean.

field.name: Request Identifier
field.description: The unique identifier for this request.

field.name: Communication Mean
field.description: Communication mean to be used to transfer these data.

field.name: Destination System
field.description: The name of the system where to send this message.

field.name: Deadline
field.description: Deadline for message transmission (seconds since epoch).

field.name: Range
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

field.name: Data Mode
field.description: Type of data to be transmitted. Abort and Range mode can only be used with comm_mean=ACOUSTIC

field.name: Message Data
field.description: Data to be transmitted if selected *data_mode* is *INLINEMSG*.

field.name: Text Data
field.description: Data to be transmitted if selected *data_mode* is *TEXT*.

field.name: Raw Data
field.description: Data to be transmitted if selected *data_mode* is *RAW*.

message.name: Transmission Status
message.description: Reply sent in response to a communications request.

field.name: Range
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

message.name: SMS Transmission Request
message.description: Request SMS Text sending.

field.name: Destination
field.description: Recipient identifier (number or name).

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Period of time to send message (in seconds).

message.name: SMS Transmission Status
message.description: Reply sent in response to a SMS sending request.

field.name: Information
field.description: Error description.

message.name: VTOL State
message.description: Reports VTOL current state.

value.name: Undefined
value.description: Vehicle is not configured as VTOL.

value.name: Transition to Fixed-Wing
value.description: Vehicle is in transition from multicopter to fixed-wing.

value.name: Transition to MultiCopter
value.description: Vehicle is in transition from fixed-wing to multicopter.

value.name: MutiCopter
value.description: Vehicle is in multicopter state.

value.name: Fixed-Wing

message.name: Arming State
